fact_list.fact_text: All persons travelling in vehicles, irrespective of their age, should be appropriately belted up.
Adults below the height of 1.35m shall use booster seats or approved adjustable seat belts to lower the risk of injury in the event of an accident.
A composition fine of $120 and 3 demerit points will be awarded for failing to belt up.
At night (between 7.00pm and 7.00am), you must drive with your headlights on.
At night, always drive well within the limits of your headlights.
Use dipped headlights at night in built-up areas and during rainy weather.
On unlit roads, always use your high beam.
Dip your headlights when meeting other vehicles and cyclists.
If you are dazzled by the lights of another vehicle, slow down and stop if necessary.
Dip your headlights when driving behind other vehicles.
